decision: Package name specify-cli will be renamed to flowspec-cli
rationale: Aligns package name with repository name and project branding. Users searching for flowspec should find flowspec-cli, not specify-cli.
impact: Breaking change - existing installation commands become invalid

decision: Python module name specify_cli will be renamed to flowspec_cli
rationale: Module name must match package name convention (hyphens become underscores)
alternatives_considered: Keep specify_cli with flowspec-cli package name
impact: All import statements change from 'from specify_cli' to 'from flowspec_cli'

decision: CLI command 'specify' will be renamed to 'flowspec'
rationale: Command name should match project branding for discoverability
impact: All documentation and user workflows referencing 'specify' command need updates

rationale: Consistent naming across all user-facing paths
alternatives_considered: Keep old path for backward compatibility
impact: Existing user data needs migration or re-initialization

rationale: URL ownership unknown, may not be under project control
impact: Documentation may have dead links until resolved

decision: Phased rollout: documentation first, then code
rationale: Documentation-only changes are low-risk and can be merged independently. Validates CI before making breaking code changes.
alternatives_considered: Single atomic PR with all changes
impact: Multiple PRs needed, but each is smaller and safer

decision: All tasks tagged with refactor-specify label in beads
rationale: Easy filtering and tracking of all related work

decision: No backward compatibility alias for specify command
rationale: Clean break simplifies maintenance. Users expected to migrate fully.
alternatives_considered: Add specify as alias to flowspec
impact: Existing scripts using 'specify' will break immediately

decision: Feature branch per phase (planning, docs, code)
rationale: Allows independent review and rollback of each phase
impact: More PRs but cleaner git history

decision: Migration guide required before code changes merge
rationale: Users need clear instructions before breaking change lands
impact: Task spec-l8o.9 created for migration documentation
